intro: Cossinia borbonica, commonly known as the Bourbon cossinia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in yellow or white, and it produces small, hard seeds. Cossinia borbonica is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native environment.
